<li id=""214faq-category"" class=""faq-category"" data-category=""214"" aria-selected=""false"" role=""tab"" aria-controls=""214faq-category"">
<li id=""234faq-category"" class=""faq-category"" data-category=""234"" aria-selected=""false"" role=""tab"" aria-controls=""234faq-category"">
<li id=""235faq-category"" class=""faq-category"" data-category=""235"" aria-selected=""false"" role=""tab"" aria-controls=""235faq-category"">
<li id=""236faq-category"" class=""faq-category"" data-category=""236"" aria-selected=""false"" role=""tab"" aria-controls=""236faq-category"">
How close to campus are you?
​Union Knoxville is just 0.6 miles from the University of Tennessee!

​Union Knoxville is pet-friendly! Dogs and cats under 75 pounds are more than welcome at our community. Please check with the leasing office regarding restricted breeds and costs associated with bringing your furry friend!
How many people live there?
​Union Knoxville is set to acommodate 712 residents at our community. We can't wait to meet you!
Can additional furniture be brought into the apartment?
​You may bring any additional furniture you would like to! Please keep in mind that Union Knoxville will NOT remove or store the provided furniture for you if you choose to bring your own.
Do I need to have liability insurance?

Yes, every resident is required to obtain a minimum of $100,000 in liability insurance. Verification of coverage will be necessary before Will can receive his keys. Our insurance partner, Assurant, will be sending out instructions closer to move-in on how to easily enroll or provide proof of coverage. Please be advised that liability insurance does NOT cover your personal belongings. You may obtain a renters' insurance policy if you desire.
What Should I Bring To My New Apartment?

column1: What If I Need Something Repaired In My Apartment?

column12: ><span class=""TextRun SCXW182003690 BCX0"" data-contrast=""auto"" lang=""EN-US"" style=""margin: 0px
column27: >Our onsite, professional maintenance team would be happy to help you. We will need some details so be prepared to provide specifics with your requests. You may
column37: > a service request in the following ways:

column12: ><span class=""TextRun SCXW182003690 BCX0"" data-contrast=""auto"" lang=""EN-US"" style=""margin: 0px
column22: xml:lang=""EN-US"">Option 1: Enter a service request through the online resident portal.

column12: ><span class=""TextRun SCXW182003690 BCX0"" data-contrast=""auto"" lang=""EN-US"" style=""margin: 0px
column22: xml:lang=""EN-US"">Option 2: E‐mail your request to your community and a team member will enter a service request on your behalf.

column12: ><span class=""TextRun SCXW182003690 BCX0"" data-contrast=""auto"" lang=""EN-US"" style=""margin: 0px
column22: xml:lang=""EN-US"">Option 3: Visit or call the office during normal business hours and a team member will be happy to enter your service request. If it is after business hours, you are welcome to leave a message with an after-hours representative.

column12: ><span class=""TextRun SCXW182003690 BCX0"" data-contrast=""auto"" lang=""EN-US"" style=""margin: 0px
column27: >For Emergency Requests: A maintenance team member is on call 24/7 for emergency maintenance needs (
column37: > door/window lock issues, major leaks, plumbing, no heat or AC during weather extremes, refrigerator not cooling, no electricity/gas/water, etc.).

column1: How Does Roommate Matching Work?

column14: xml:lang=""EN-US"">Are you looking for more control over how you are matched with roommates? Through the RoomSync app, residents are empowered to choose roommates and build a sense of community using lifestyle habits such as cleanliness levels, studying habits, sleep cycles, and more. RoomSync offers an experience that supports a diverse and inclusive matching community through gender-inclusive tools. Furthermore, the app recognizes the importance of living criteria like service and emotional support animals and factors this into the matching process.

column1: If I pay in full, do I get a discount?
​We do not offer a discount for paying in full at this time.
When do I put down a deposit?
​Your deposit must be paid prior to your lease being executed.
Will you send me a bill each month for my rent?
​You will not recieve an invoice each month

column1: When is my first payment due?
​Fall 2024 residents' first installment of rent is due by August 1st, 2024.
What Are Rental Installments? Why Is My Rent Not Prorated?

column1: Will my financial aid cover my rent?

column19: >Your living costs can be covered by financial aid, just like on-campus housing. Any available financial aid funds, after university charges are satisfied, are released to the student for non-institutional expenses, such as off-campus housing. These funds can be used to pay
column29: > Normal payment deadlines will continue to apply.

column1: What is included in the rental installment?

column14: xml:lang=""EN-US"">Your rental installment includes community-wide Wi-Fi, furniture, maintenance, amenities, and community events!

column1: Can I pay my bill with a credit card? Is there an extra charge?

​You can make payments online with a credit card. There are transaction fees that apply with the use of a credit card and it is a percentage based off the amount of the transaction. You will be shown the convenience fee when making the payment and will be required to agree to the extra fee before the payment is processed.
What utilities are included in my rent?

column2: font-family: SourceSansPro, "">Your rent includes high-speed Wi-Fi, free printing, furniture, incredible maintenance, amenities, and community-wide events!

column1: How do our rates compare to on-campus housing rates?

​When comparing our rates to on-campus rates you must take into consideration many variables, including floor plan layout, square footage, furniture, utilities, and community events. Our leasing staff is available to discuss with you how our rates compare to other housing options and validate that our community offers you the best value for your money, as well as a great location and incredible amenities.
<div class=""faq-content 235-faq-content"" id=""235-faq-content"" role=""tabpanel"" aria-labelledby=""235-faq-category"" style=""display: none
What types of leases are available?

​At Union Knoxville, we provide individual leases! An individual lease means that you are only responsible for your rental installment and not the rent of your roommate. With an individual lease, you have the rights to joint use of the common spaces and then individual rights to your bedroom and bathroom. All of our individual leases are for 12-month periods.
Do I need a guarantor?
​Yes. All leases are required to have a guarantor. If an approved guarantor cannot be obtained, Union Knoxville will accept a security deposit equal to one month’s rent.
What if I need to cancel my lease?
​You will be responsible for finding an individual to relet your lease from you! Contact our team for further details.
How Long Is The Lease Agreement?

column4: >Leases at Union Knoxville begin in mid-August and terminate in late July. Payments are broken up into 12 equal installments.

column1: What is a guarantor, and do I need one?

column19: >A guarantor is an individual who signs a lease agreement along with a renter promising to uphold the lease agreement in the event a renter defaults on their financial obligations.
column24: > The guarantor can be a parent, spouse, extended family member, or friend but will need to be in good financial standing and pass all necessary screenings.

column1: When can I move in?
​On the date your lease begins! Union Knoxville does not anticipate being able to acommodate early move-ins. We will send out communication regarding move-in times
column2: and processes closer to the lease start date.

column1: Do I need to be a student to live here?

column1: ​Yes, all our apartments are fully furnished! You are more than welcome to bring any additional furniture of your own, but please keep in mind that we will not store furniture for you. If you choose to remove any of the provided furniture, you will need to store it yourself and bring it back before the end of the lease term in its original condition.

​Union Knoxville provides covered garage parking! Parking spaces are limited, and there is a monthly cost associated with parking in our garage. Residents who secure parking for the lease term will be given an assigned spot and gate access to the garage. Any resident parked in a spot other than the one assigned to them will be subject to tow.

}"" title=""Link to Entrata's Accessibility Statement"" aria-haspopup=""dialog"">Entrata's Accessibility Statement

Entrata, Inc. (“Entrata”) is dedicated to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually applying relevant accessibility standards to improve user experience for everyone who visits this website.

Our Standards:
column2: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) has established Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) for website designers and developers to improve accessibility for individuals with disabilities, and this website strives to be conformant to WCAG 2.1 level AA. Entrata is proud of the efforts that we have completed and that are in-progress to ensure that our website is accessible to everyone.

Entrata, Inc. (“Entrata”) is dedicated to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually applying relevant accessibility standards to improve user experience for everyone who visits this website.

Our Standards:
column2: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) has established Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) for website designers and developers to improve accessibility for individuals with disabilities, and this website strives to be conformant to WCAG 2.1 level AA. Entrata, Inc. (“Entrata”) is dedicated to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually applying relevant accessibility standards to improve user experience for everyone who visits this website.

Our Standards:
column2: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) has established Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) for website designers and developers to improve accessibility for individuals with disabilities, and this website strives to be conformant to WCAG 2.1 level AA. Entrata is proud of the efforts that we have completed and that are in-progress to ensure that our website is accessible to everyone.
column3:
Feedback:

Entrata welcomes feedback in relation to the accessibility of this website. Please reach out to us at:

4205 Chapel Ridge Road
Lehi, UT 84043
--or--
Send us a message

We will do our best to respond to your feedback within five business days.

}"" title=""Link to Entrata's Accessibility Statement"" aria-haspopup=""dialog"">Entrata's Accessibility Statement

Entrata, Inc. (“Entrata”) is dedicated to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually applying relevant accessibility standards to improve user experience for everyone who visits this website.

Our Standards:
column2: The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) has established Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) for website designers and developers to improve accessibility for individuals with disabilities, and this website strives to be conformant to WCAG 2.1 level AA. Entrata is proud of the efforts that we have completed and that are in-progress to ensure that our website is accessible to everyone.
column3:
Feedback:

Entrata welcomes feedback in relation to the accessibility of this website. Please reach out to us at:
column4:
Entrata, Inc.
Attn: Accessibility
4205 Chapel Ridge Road
Lehi, UT 84043
--or--
Send us a message

We will do our best to respond to your feedback within five business days.
This statement was issued on August 24, 2020 by Entrata, Inc.
